Vulnerability.Title: redhat-indexhtml bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
An updated redhat-indexhtml package that fixes one bug is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The redhat-indexhtml package provides a welcome page shown by a web browser after successful installation of Red Hat Enterprise Linux. This web page advises users on how to register their Red Hat software and how to get any support they might need.
This update fixes the following bug:
* Translations of the default Red Hat welcome page for some of the supported locales, such as es-ES, ta-IN, and or-IN, were incomplete, providing customers with inaccurate or incomplete content on the initial launch of their web browsers. This update updates the affected translations, ensuring that the Red Hat welcome page provides the correct and complete information for each supported locale. (BZ#1099094)
Users of redhat-indexhtml are advised to upgrade to this updated package, which fixes this bug.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
